document_title: Botulinum poisoning: Symptoms, causes and prevention
subsection_content:
Botulinum poisoning can paralyze muscles, especially swallowing and breathing muscles. Although antitoxins are helpful in many cases, some people still die from respiratory problems and infections. In addition, other complications due to botulinum poisoning include:
Extreme fatigue.; Long-term weakness.; Shortness of breath.; Pneumonia and infection.; Nervous system problems.
Botulinum poisoning can paralyze muscles, especially swallowing and breathing muscles.
